scriptmanager.scripts.Peak_Analysis

Class TileGenome

  • java.lang.Object
    • scriptmanager.scripts.Peak_Analysis.TileGenome

  • public class TileGenome
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with static method for creating a coordinate file of tiles across a genome.
    Author:
    William KM Lai
    See Also:
    TileGenomeCLI, GenomeSizeReference, TileGenomeWindow

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public static void execute(java.lang.String GENOME,
                           int windowSize,
                           boolean BEDout,
                           java.io.File OUTPUT)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create and write output BED/GFF file of genomic intervals tiling the genome. All entries will be "+" stranded, score="0.0", and the identifier column is a genomic coordinate string (<chr>_<start>_<stop>_<dir>). For the BED format, the identifier column will be the 4th column while the GFF format will use the 9th column for the identifier.
        Parameters:
        GENOME - the String encoding the genome build to tile (matches util.GenomeSizeReference)
        windowSize - the base-pair length of the tiles
        BEDout - coordinate file format of output where BED-format is used if true and GFF-format used if false
        OUTPUT - the file to write the coordinate tile output to (if null, a default filename is determined using <GENOME>_<windowSize>bp.<ext>)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
